1901430.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901430
In-book reference  : Book 24, Hadith 001
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 24, Hadith 001
1901430.text: 'A’isha said: "The family of Muhammad (Allah bless him and give him peace) did not satisfy their appetite with barley-bread for before even two consecutive days until Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) was taken from this world.”

1901440.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901440
In-book reference  : Book 24, Hadith 002
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 24, Hadith 002
1901440.text: Abu Umama al-Bahili say: "There was never more than a bare sufficiency of barley- bread for the people of the household of Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace).”

1901450.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901450
In-book reference  : Book 24, Hadith 003
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 24, Hadith 003
1901450.text: Ibn 'Abbas said: "Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) used to spend night after night starving. He and his family would not have any supper to eat, and most of their bread was barley-bread.”

1901460.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901460
In-book reference  : Book 24, Hadith 004
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 24, Hadith 004
1901460.text: Sahl ibn Sa'd said that he was asked: “Did Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) eat the finest flour, meaning white bread?” Sahl said: “Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) did not see the finest flour until he met Allah (Almighty and Glorious is He).” Then he was asked: “Did you have sieves in the time of Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace)?” He said: “We did not have sieves.” He was asked: “How did you treat barley?” He said: “We used to blow on it, so whatever flew would fly off it, and then we would knead it.”

1901470.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901470
In-book reference  : Book 24, Hadith 005
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 24, Hadith 005
1901470.text: Anas ibn Malik said: “Allah’s Prophet (Allah bless him and give him peace) did not eat food on a table, nor in a bowl, and no bread rolled thin and flat was baked for him. I asked Qatada: ‘So on what were they used to eating?’ He said: ‘On these pieces of skin [on which food for the journey is put].”

1901480.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901480
In-book reference  : Book 24, Hadith 006
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 24, Hadith 006
1901480.text: Masruq said: "I went in to see 'A'isha, so she ordered a meal for me, and she said: “I do not eat my fill from a meal, for I feel like weeping, if I have not wept.” I said: “Why?” She said: “I remember the state in which Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) departed from this world. By Allah, he did not eat his fill of bread and meat twice in one day!”

1901490.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901490
In-book reference  : Book 24, Hadith 007
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 24, Hadith 007
1901490.text: 'A’isha said: "Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) did not eat his fill of barley-bread for two days in a row until he died.”

1901500.reference:
Reference  : Shama'il Muhammadiyah 1901500
In-book reference  : Book 24, Hadith 008
English translation  : Vol. 1, Book 24, Hadith 008
1901500.text: Anas said: “Allah’s Messenger (Allah bless him and give him peace) did not eat food on a table, and he did not eat bread rolled thin and flat, until he died.”
